Navigating Newsgroup Lists: Usenet newsgroups are generally broken into main hierarchies like "Alt", "Comp", "Rec", etc., as well as sub hierarchies which are a collection of groups that fall under a broad topic like "sports", "music", "writing", etc. As an example, "alt.sport.bowling" is a specific newsgroup, which falls under the "alt.sport.*" sub hierarchy, which in turn falls under the main hierarchy known as "Alt". By clicking on the blue arrow or hierarchy links within Direct Read News...

...users can jump from their current newsgroup, to a list of similar newsgroups within that sub hierarchy, or back to a larger list of newsgroups that fall within a more general main hierarchy. In this example, you may be in the "alt.binaries.multimedia.anime" newsgroup, and if you wanted to see a list of other multimedia newsgroups within the hierarchy (alt.binaries.multimedia.disney, etc.), you would click on the "alt.binaries.multimedia.*" hierarchy link noted above.

Navigating Article Lists: Depending upon the popularity of a specific newsgroup, you may enter a group to find that 10 articles, or over 10,000+ articles, have been posted there. In the event that you access a newsgroup with a large number of articles, Direct Read News will display that list in groups of 50 to 100 articles at a time. In order to navigate between article pages within a newsgroup, you would use the following tool...

The hyperlinked numbers (17.18.19) represent the number of article pages within a newsgroup, and you can jump to a specific page by simply clicking on one of the numbers that appears between the "Back" and "More" buttons. The page you are currently on will appear as a larger font than the other page numbers (1 in this example) and should appear as a different color as well.

Page numbers are displayed in increments of 20, and you would use the "Back" and "More" buttons to retrieve the previous or next group of page numbers. As an example, if you were currently viewing pages 31-50, and you clicked on the "More" button, you would retrieve the next collection of article pages which would be 51-70. If you clicked on the "Back" button instead, you would retrieve article pages 11-30. A "Start" button will bring you back to first article page within a newsgroup.
